item.title: UK Water Utilities' Shares Rise after Thames Water Funding Pact
item.description: U.K. water-utility shares rose on news that Thames Water investors have agreed to a further £750 million of equity funding through to 2025, with an additional £2.5 billion expected over the five-year plan.

item.title: Metals Move Lower As Markets Look to Inflation Data
item.description: Base metals and gold prices moved lower, as investors look to Wednesday’s U.S. CPI data, which will likely determine whether the Fed looks to stop hiking interest rates in the near term.

item.title: Glynn's Take: RBA Loses Old Hands at Critical Juncture for Economy
item.description: The departure of Luci Ellis as chief economist from the RBA is part of a recent exodus from the central bank that has stripped it of decades of experience and talent just as the economy approaches its most challenging moment in a generation.

item.title: Oil Pares Gains After Volatile Week
item.description: Oil prices fell in early trading, as this week’s focus will be on the release of of the IEA and OPEC’s market reports to see how demand is faring, ANZ said, while the U.S.’s plans to purchase 6 million barrels for its Strategic Reserve could also add impetus for prices.

item.title: Dollar Recovers After Dropping Following Friday's US Jobs Data
item.description: The dollar recovered modestly early in the European session, with Commerzbank saying the steep falls for the currency on Friday weren’t justified as “previous dollar levels were obviously based on an overly optimistic view of the U.S. labor market.”

item.title: Eurozone Core Bond Curve Inversion Seen Supportive for Peripherals
item.description: Strong curve inversion for core eurozone government bonds is supporting demand for peripheral bonds, LBBW said.

item.title: BT CEO to Step Down
item.description: BT said its Chief Executive Philip Jansen plans to leave his role over the next year and that it has started a formal search for his replacement.

item.title: Novartis Keeps Outlook Despite US Court Decision
item.description: Novartis said a Delaware district court established the patent on its heart-failure drug Entresto was invalid, but the company maintained its guidance for 2023 and its mid-term outlook.

item.title: Biden to Meet With Sunak, King Charles, Kicking Off Europe Trip
item.description: The president travels next to Lithuania for NATO’s annual summit and Finland.

item.title: Deflation Looms in China as Rebound Continues to Lose Steam
item.description: China’s consumer inflation flatlined in June after two months of meager growth, while factory-gate prices fell at their fastest pace in more than seven years.

item.title: BOJ Raises Economic Assessment for Three of Nine Regions
item.description: The Bank of Japan on Monday raised its economic assessment for three of the nation’s nine regions and maintained its view for the other areas.

item.title: Icahn Gets Breathing Room From Lenders Following Short-Seller Attack
item.description: The deal unties his personal loans from the trading price of his company’s shares, increase his collateral and set up a plan to fully repay the loans in three years.

item.title: Why Ukraine Is Struggling to Puncture Russia's Formidable Defenses
item.description: The recent turmoil in Russia could provide an opportunity for Ukraine’s battlefield forces. WSJ reporter Ian Lovett and retired Brigadier Gen. Mark Kimmitt break down what might be next for the Ukrainian counteroffensive.

item.title: Wave of Rental Resets to Further Deplete Affordable Housing
item.description: Expiring government protections mean landlords could charge market rates.

item.title: Five Ways the Bull Market Makes Investors Nervous
item.description: Investors can’t stop looking over their shoulders for major risks looming in markets.

item.title: Pope Francis said he would elevate 21 men, including a U.S.-born archbishop, to the College of Cardinals on Sept. 30, deepening his imprint on the body that will elect his successor.
item.description: Pope Francis said he would elevate 21 men, including a U.S.-born archbishop, to the College of Cardinals on Sept. 30, deepening his imprint on the body that will elect his successor.

item.title: Lawmakers return to Capitol Hill this week to face a stacked legislative agenda with thethreat of a government shutdown loomingin the fall.
item.description: Lawmakers return to Capitol Hill this week to face a stacked legislative agenda with the threat of a government shutdown looming in the fall.

item.title: A panel of appellate judges ruled that a Tennessee law banning gender-affirming medical treatment for transgender youth could take effect, the first time a federal court has allowed such a prohibition to come into force.
item.description: A panel of appellate judges ruled that a Tennessee law banning gender-affirming medical treatment for transgender youth could take effect, the first time a federal court has allowed such a prohibition to come into force.

item.title: Record immigration to affluent countries is sparking bigger backlashes across the world, boosting populist parties andputting pressure on governments to tighten policies to stem the migration wave.
item.description: Record immigration to affluent countries is sparking bigger backlashes across the world, boosting populist parties and putting pressure on governments to tighten policies to stem the migration wave.

item.title: An Oklahoma judge dismissed a lawsuit brought by three survivors of the 1921 Tulsa Race Massacre who sought reparations for the attack in the city's Greenwood district.
item.description: An Oklahoma judge dismissed a lawsuit brought by three survivors of the 1921 Tulsa Race Massacre who sought reparations for the attack in the city’s Greenwood district.
